result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Todd Andrew Aarthun was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court merges and dismisses Count 2.
Court notes 2 days credit against ultimate sentence.
Defendant remanded into custody.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF: Todd Andrew Aarthun appeared. Case called at 10:01. Atty. O'Boyle updates the court. ADA Nieskes agrees and amends to a OWI 4th  a misdemeanor. Court amends. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 14CF342. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 in 14CF342 midsemeanor OWI 4th. On motion of the State without objection, Crt merge and dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF342. Sentencing arguments. DE is in the aftercare treatment program at the Hudson Medical Center right now. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
 2 years probation
 Court notes 2 days credit against any ultimate sentence.
- 60 days condition time. 
  Huber granted for work or seek work. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through.
- 30 months  IID
- 30 months drivers license revocation
  with credit for any administrative suspension. 
-  $2,452.00 inclusive of costs
  Bond forfeited and the the remainder to be paid through DOC
- $75 to the River Falls PD.
-  Random and regular testing.  
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Victim impact panel. 
- DE to serve first 48 hours  and released on furlough. DE to report back to the jail on Jan. 1, 6:00pm to finish condition time. 

DE is remanded.
